Entries.default: In the distance, you spy the entrance to a cave sunken into a hillside, barely hidden behind the stunted, shriveled trunks of leafless trees.
Once again you stand before the bone-littered cave, and once again you steel yourself against the smell of rot so damp and pungent it seems almost to coat your skin.
You linger at the entrance to the cave. The passage beyond extends into pitch-black darkness. It reeks of death and decay.
As you approach the cave, something snaps beneath your boot. You look down, expecting a stick, and find the splintered remains of ancient bone.
You see the ground before the cave with new eyes. What you first thought were branches are bones - some half-buried in the dirt, others piled in drifts. Many are bleached white with age.
